title: Strong Gender Equality Initiatives
description: In 2019, Moldova achieved a CPIA gender equality rating of 4.5, indicating a strong commitment to gender equality compared to other nations.

title: High Female Labor Force Participation
description: As of 2024, females constitute 54.72% of Moldova's total labor force, showcasing a significant female presence in the workforce.

title: Low Liner Shipping Connectivity
description: In 2020, Moldova's liner shipping connectivity index was 0.64, indicating limited integration into global shipping networks.

title: Minimal Container Port Traffic
description: With only 818 TEUs handled in 2019, Moldova's container port traffic is among the lowest, highlighting limited maritime trade activity.

title: Extended Lead Time for Imports
description: In 2016, the median lead time to import goods into Moldova was 32 days, reflecting inefficiencies in import logistics.

title: Limited Unemployment Benefits Coverage
description: In 2017, only 0.03% of Moldova's richest quintile received unemployment benefits, indicating limited social safety nets.

title: High Mortality from Unintentional Poisoning
description: In 2021, Moldova recorded a mortality rate of 4.15 per 100,000 due to unintentional poisoning, with males being particularly affected at 6.71 per 100,000.

title: Fair Income Distribution Among the Lowest 10%
description: In 2022, the lowest 10% of Moldova's population held 4.5% of the income share, suggesting a relatively equitable income distribution.

title: Low Female Employer Representation
description: In 2023, only 7.97% of female employment in Moldova was in employer roles, indicating a gender gap in leadership positions.
